description:
The hottest battle is about to begin!

While attending Tensei Academy, Hiiro Ryuugasaki ends up acquiring a mysterious smartphone. It comes installed with the popular card game, Shadowverse! Meeting new rivals, facing major tournaments, forging bonds with friends... Shadowverse leads Hiiro to all sorts of new experiences, all that serve to "evolve" him...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

node.description: Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
Not to be confused with the mangaka [Takahiro Kamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/154811/Takahiro-Kamiya).
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

**Height:** 150 cm

[Website](http://www.ogurayui.jp) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ogurayui-0815) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OY_A_Official) | [Twitter (Personal)](https://twitter.com/yui_ogura_815) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjoIKN4CybsJyv0pWwAUJ5w) | [LINE](https://lineblog.me/ogurayui) | [Clare Voice](http://clare-voice.co.jp/talent) | [YuiKaori](http://www.yuikaori.info) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27839.html) | [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%80%89%E5%94%AF) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_ogura_official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@yui_ogura_offcial)

Not to be confused with [Yui Ogura (小倉結衣)](https://anilist.co/staff/123771).

Yui Ogura is an idol, actress, singer and voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with Clare Voice. She is one of four members in Team Dekaris along with Kaori Ishihara, Arisa Noto, and Maho Matsunaga. She was one half of J-Pop duo [YuiKaori](https://anilist.co/staff/195974/), along with [Kaori Ishihara](https://anilist.co/staff/105217/) before the group disbanded in 2017. She is a former member of the seiyuu group [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177/), which was formed in 2011 and composed of the same members of Team Dekaris. Ogura's debut single "Raise" was released on July 18, 2012. She graduated from the group in April 2013.

PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist

- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass
